techmeme.title: Deep-Live-Cam, a deepfake software project that lets users impersonate others on a webcam livestream, goes viral and was briefly the top trending GitHub repo (Benj Edwards/Ars Technica)
Encord, which offers a data labeling tools for AI, raised a $30M Series B led by Next47 and expects to grow its headcount from 70 to 100 by the end of the year (Kyle Wiggers/TechCrunch)
The US Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit ruled that geofence warrants are "prohibited by the Fourth Amendment", at odds with a recent Fourth Circuit ruling (Zack Whittaker/TechCrunch)
Hands-on with Gemini Live: conversationally, a big step forward, but functionally, a step back in some ways, largely because it works entirely in the cloud (Joanna Stern/Wall Street Journal)
Overview of AI features for Pixel devices including the Gemini assistant, Call Notes for call summaries, Pixel Studio for image generation, Pixel Screenshots (Molly McHugh-Johnson/The Keyword)
